devdoc.details: Vea Outbox From Gnosis to Arbitrum. Note: This contract is deployed on Arbitrum.

Challenged(uint256,address).details: This event indicates that `sendSnapshot(epoch)` should be called in the inbox.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the challenged claim.

Claimed(address,uint256,bytes32).details: Watchers check this event to challenge fraud.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the claim.
params._stateRoot: The state root of the claim.

MessageRelayed(uint64).details: This event indicates that a message has been relayed.

params._msgId: The msgId of the message that was relayed.

Verified(uint256).details: This events indicates that verification has succeeded. The messages are ready to be relayed.

sequencerDelayLimitUpdateReceived(uint25.details: This event indicates the sequencer limit updated.

challenge(uint256).details: Submit a challenge for the claim of the inbox state root snapshot taken at 'epoch'.

params._epoch: The epoch of the claim to challenge.

claim(uint256,bytes32).details: Submit a claim about the _stateRoot at _epoch and submit a deposit.

params._epoch: The epoch for which the claim is made.

constructor.details: Constructor. Note: epochPeriod must match the VeaInboxGnosisToArb contract deployment on Arbitrum, since it's on a different chain, we can't read it and trust the deployer to set a correct value

params._challengePeriod: The duration of the period allowing to challenge a claim.
params._deposit: The deposit amount to submit a claim in wei.
params._routerGnosisToArb: The address of the router on Ethereum that routes from Arbitrum to Ethereum.
params._sequencerDelayLimit: The maximum delay in seconds that the Arbitrum sequencer can backdate transactions.
params._sequencerFutureLimit: The maximum delay in seconds that the Arbitrum sequencer can futuredate transactions.
params._timeoutEpochs: The epochs before the bridge is considered shutdown.

epochAt(uint256).details: Get the current epoch from the outbox's point of view using the Ethereum L1 clock.

epochNow().details: Get the current epoch from the outbox's point of view using the Ethereum L1 clock.

resolveDisputedClaim(uint256,bytes32).details: Resolves any challenge of the optimistic claim for '_epoch'.

params._stateRoot: The true state root for the epoch.

sendMessage(bytes32[],uint64,address,byt.details: Verifies and relays the message. UNTRUSTED.

params._message: The message encoded with header from VeaInbox.
params._msgId: The zero based index of the message in the inbox.
params._proof: The merkle proof to prove the message.
params._to: The address of the contract on Gnosis to call.

updateSequencerDelayLimit(uint256,uint25.details: Set the sequencerDelayLimit by reading from the Arbitrum Bridge

params._newSequencerDelayLimit: The delaySeconds from the MaxTimeVariation struct in the Arbitrum Sequencer contract.

updateSequencerFutureLimit(uint256,uint2.details: Set the sequencerFutureLimit by reading from the Arbitrum Bridge

params._newSequencerFutureLimit: The delaySeconds from the MaxTimeVariation struct in the Arbitrum Sequencer contract.

params._epoch: The epoch of the optimistic claim.

withdrawChallengeDeposit(uint256).details: Sends the deposit back to the Challenger if successful. Includes a portion of the Bridger's deposit.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the challenge deposit to withraw.

withdrawChallengerEscapeHatch(uint256).details: When bridge is shutdown, no claim disputes can be resolved. This allows the challenger to withdraw their deposit.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the claim deposit to withraw.

withdrawClaimDeposit(uint256).details: Sends the deposit back to the Claimer if successful. Includes a portion of the Challenger's deposit if unsuccessfully challenged.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the claim deposit to withraw.

withdrawClaimerEscapeHatch(uint256).details: When bridge is shutdown, no claim disputes can be resolved. This allows the claimer to withdraw their deposit.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the claim deposit to withraw.
